intro: Mammillaria vallensis, commonly known as the Mexican pincushion cactus, is a species native to the highlands of Mexico. It is a small, globular cactus with a dense covering of white, woolly spines. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–10 centimeters and features a greenish-gray stem with prominent tubercles. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, blooming in late spring or early summer. Mammillaria vallensis is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
